I think the gradient with respect to images can be easily implemented by applying reversed rotation on the gradient coming from top. i.e. if out_grad is gradient with respect to out, then

images_grad = tf.contrib.image.rotate(out_grad, -angles)

Gradient with respect to angles might be trickier. However, I do not need this functionality.

body:
I think the gradient with respect to `images` can be easily implemented by applying reversed rotation on the gradient coming from top. i.e. if `out_grad` is gradient with respect to `out`, then
```
images_grad = tf.contrib.image.rotate(out_grad, -angles)
```

Gradient with respect to `angles` might be trickier. However, I do not need this functionality.
